entities.name: gnome
entities.description: The text describes gnomes as small creatures that can fly and have razor-sharp teeth. They are being caught by Harry, Fred, George, and Ron in a game of 'de-gnoming'.

entities.name: fred
entities.description: Fred is one of the players who is participating in the game of de-gnoming. He claims he can get his gnome beyond a stump.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is another player who is participating in the game of de-gnoming. He learns to drop the gnomes over the hedge instead of trying to catch them.

entities.name: george
entities.description: George is one of the players who is participating in the game of de-gnoming. He claims that gnomes are not too bright and will storm up to have a look when they know the de-gnoming is on.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is one of the players who is participating in the game of de-gnoming. He claims that the gnomes will be back and that they love it.

relationships.description: Harry is catching gnomes in the game of de-gnoming. The text describes how Harry has a hard job shaking off one gnome that sinks its teeth into his finger.
Fred is also catching gnomes in the game of de-gnoming. He claims he can get his gnome beyond a stump.
George is catching multiple gnomes at once in the game of de-gnoming. He claims that gnomes are not too bright and will storm up to have a look when they know the de-gnoming is on.
Ron is also catching gnomes in the game of de-gnoming. He claims that the gnomes will be back and that they love it.

Harry and Fred are competing with each other in the game of de-gnoming. The text describes how Harry learns to drop the gnomes over the hedge instead of trying to catch them, implying that he is trying to outdo Fred.
